Benefits of a Latex Mattress

  • Pain Relieving. The gentle cushioning and buoyant support of latex foam mattresses are especially beneficial for sleepers with back and joint pain
  • Hypoallergenic and Low Maintenance
  • Eco-friendly
  • Breathable
  • Durable
  • Ideal for Hot Sleepers

Let’s outline some of the main benefits of using latex mattresses:

  • Support: Because of the natural elastic properties incorporated into latex mattresses, they offer unmatched support and pressure relief during use. Its naturally conforming design instantly responds to your body’s unique composition and movements. Side sleepers make up the majority of the population, and while latex mattresses offer support for back, stomach and side sleepers, there is extra support offered for those who sleep on their sides. Side sleepers often suffer from pain in their shoulders, torso, and hips from the pressure of sleeping with all of their body weight on these points. Latex mattresses offer specialized support for these sleepers.
  • Long-lasting: Latex mattresses are naturally resilient and thus maintain their shape and performance for several years. Conventional mattresses “soften” and tend to lose their firmness over time, but that is not a factor with latex mattresses. On average, a latex mattress only needs to be replaced once every 10 years.
  • Hypoallergenic: Latex is resistant to dust and mites, helping to maintain an allergy-free sleep atmosphere.
  • Easy maintenance: Since latex is naturally resistant to dust and is naturally resilient, these mattresses require little to no maintenance.

Benefits of a Latex Mattress

  • Pain Relieving. The gentle cushioning and buoyant support of latex foam mattresses are especially beneficial for sleepers with back and joint pain
  • Hypoallergenic and Low Maintenance
  • Eco-friendly
  • Breathable
  • Durable
  • Ideal for Hot Sleepers

Let’s outline some of the main benefits of using latex mattresses:

  • Support: Because of the natural elastic properties incorporated into latex mattresses, they offer unmatched support and pressure relief during use. Its naturally conforming design instantly responds to your body’s unique composition and movements. Side sleepers make up the majority of the population, and while latex mattresses offer support for back, stomach and side sleepers, there is extra support offered for those who sleep on their sides. Side sleepers often suffer from pain in their shoulders, torso, and hips from the pressure of sleeping with all of their body weight on these points. Latex mattresses offer specialized support for these sleepers.
  • Long-lasting: Latex mattresses are naturally resilient and thus maintain their shape and performance for several years. Conventional mattresses “soften” and tend to lose their firmness over time, but that is not a factor with latex mattresses. On average, a latex mattress only needs to be replaced once every 10 years.
  • Hypoallergenic: Latex is resistant to dust and mites, helping to maintain an allergy-free sleep atmosphere.
  • Easy maintenance: Since latex is naturally resistant to dust and is naturally resilient, these mattresses require little to no maintenance.
